intro: Phlomoides badakshanica, commonly known as the Badakshan phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in whorls. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
